Performance and battery life are my top two priorities. Build quality comes after. Should NOT be a 2-in-1 or have a touch screen. Aesthetically I prefer ultrabooks over gaming laptops, but not if it means sacrificing specs or battery life. Within performance, my topmost priority is a decent CPU for the price range, then at least 16GB RAM (or 32GB if non-upgradable), and then any dedicated GPU from the last 5 years or so will do. I am even willing to go with a strong, newer iGPU if it checks the other boxes below. Storage must be M.2 SSD. I'm okay with 256-512GB as long as it is upgradable to at least 1TB; this is a near-must. If non-upgradable, it should be at least 1TB and have appropriate performance for the price range. For comparison, my current machine rocks a Core i7-8550u (Kaby Lake), GeForce MX150, 256GB mid-range SSD and 4+16GB DDR4 RAM. About due for an upgrade! How important is weight and thinness to you? A reasonable amount of portability is a huge plus. I don't need the cutting edge of ultra-portable, but I would like to frequently carry this laptop in my backpack and use it outside. Do you have a preferred screen size? If indifferent, put N/A. Ideally 14-15.6 inches. 16 is also okay. 1440p 60hz is enough for me and very strongly preferred over 1080p. Screen should NOT be OLED; I don't want to even think about burn-in at all. Are you doing any CAD/video editing/photo editing/gaming? List which programs/games you desire to run. Don't plan to do any CAD or heavy video/photo editing. Don't plan to run big LLMs locally (or any other heavy AI workloads), but I do plan on using it for programming, as well as editing and compiling long LaTeX documents. I want to do some light-moderate gaming, e.g. League of Legends, Slay the Spire, and modded Minecraft. Nothing AAA, and I'm okay with medium settings. I also want to be capable of doing some music production with, e.g. FL Studio, but this is very low prio. If you're gaming, do you have certain games you want to play? The bigger bottleneck here turns out to be running the world rather than rendering it, which is why the CPU is higher prio than the GPU. Very roughly speaking, I want to 2-3x the graphics performance of the MX150, at the very least. Any specific requirements such as good keyboard, reliable build quality, touch-screen, finger-print reader, optical drive or good input devices (keyboard/touchpad)? Headphone jack is very desirable. Leave any finishing thoughts here that you may feel are necessary and beneficial to the discussion. Pretty much the only thing stopping me from pulling the trigger on it is how ungodly expensive it is to get 1TB storage and 32+GB unified memory on it (let alone more cores or the M4 Pro chip).
